definitions.text: the opposition or dissimilarity of things that are compared; ,
the act of distinguishing by comparing differences

examples: there is a narrow line between sanity and insanity

definitions.text: the perceptual effect of the juxtaposition of very different colors
the range of optical density and tone on a photographic negative or print (or the extent to which adjacent areas on a television screen differ in brightness)
put in opposition to show or emphasize differences
examples: The middle school teacher contrasted her best student's work with that of her weakest student

definitions.text: to show differences when compared; be different
examples: the students contrast considerably in their artistic abilities
